top_categories.workout_context: Oregon Coast Gravel Epic's Coastal gravel, Coast Range forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
81ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Oregon Coast Gravel Epic's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
At Oregon Coast Gravel Epic, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Oregon Coast Gravel Epic. Train it until it feels boring.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Oregon Coast Gravel Epic, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
62 miles on coastal and Coast Range gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Low-cadence force work for 5,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on coastal and Coast Range gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Oregon Coast Gravel Epic’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Oregon Coast Gravel Epic. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Oregon Coast Gravel Epic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on coastal and coast range gravel to build confidence. Expect: coastal gravel, coast range, forest roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 62 miles of coastal and coast range gravel in Waldport, Oregon.
